reason: The article proposes a Covid bracelet that uses sensor technology to remind users not to touch their face, thereby reducing the transmission of COVID-19 and other diseases. This wearable device has potential applications in hospitals, education laboratories, and other settings. The authors plan to continuously develop and promote the use of this technology to support the SDG for good health and well-being.

The article discusses a delivery and logistics solution called MoveEt that aims to improve the efficiency of transport systems through digitized management. It highlights three main components of the system: MoveET Rental Fleet Management System, MoveEt Enterprise, and MoveEt Public. The system uses GPS tracking, web portals, and mobile applications to optimize business activities and provide efficient delivery services.

The article introduces Ethio Locate as a travel guide platform aiming to provide free location information and events for tourists in Ethiopia. It highlights the need for a central database due to the lack of information on hospitality services providers, which will be achieved through digital profiles for services providers. The initiative is sustainable if services providers are available.

The article discusses a solar electric three-wheeler vehicle designed to reduce greenhouse gas emissions and minimize expenditures by bringing clean energy into the transportation system. The main aim is to provide a cheapest and healthy means of transportation for low-end economic communities in sub-Saharan Africa, particularly Ethiopia. The product uses locally available resources and local capacity, aiming to contribute to climate change mitigation strategies and create employment opportunities in the automotive industry.

The article proposes a project to convert waste plastic into construction tiles, focusing on recycling 574 kg of waste plastic per day to produce 600 pieces of tiles. The project aims to address solid waste management and contribute to the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs). However, there is no detailed information about the technology used, environmental impact, or social benefits beyond the SDG alignment.

The article discusses an innovative water box designed for afforestation programs, aiming to increase tree survival rates and combat desertification through increased vegetation cover and carbon sequestration. The product is simple, reusable, and recyclable, with a unit cost of 6.8 USD per unit. It has the potential to create employment opportunities for small enterprises and engage new SMEs in afforestation businesses.

The article presents an Agri-tech solution that aims to solve smallholders' challenges and provides a human-centered design approach, IoT-powered mobile app for service providers, and innovative solutions for the agriculture mechanization ecosystem. The solution is recognized as a winner of the 2018 innovation slam award by Green Innovation Center.

The article discusses the benefits of using pyrolysis machines to recover fuel oil, carbon black, and steel wire from used tires. It highlights the advantages of this process, such as recycling 100% of waste tires, producing four valuable products with no environmental impact, and meeting increasing demand for these products.

The article discusses a sustainable method of producing green briquettes from organic waste, which can replace charcoal and reduce deforestation. The process is environmentally friendly, low-cost, and durable. It aligns with the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) related to decent work, economic growth, sustainable cities, and climate action.

The article focuses on a specific initiative called BeMistre that targets solid waste management, aiming to improve decent work opportunities and contribute to sustainable cities. It highlights the importance of recycling and SDGs 12 and 11.
